name: Consent Directive
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Community Based Collaborative Care)

element.name: ConsentDirective
element.definition: A record of a healthcare consumer’s privacy policy, which is in accordance with governing jurisdictional and organization privacy policies that grant or withhold consent:   • To one or more identified entities in a defined role   • To perform one or more operations (e.g. collect, access, use, disclose, amend, or delete)   • On an instance or type of individually identifiable health information [IIHI]  • For a purpose such as treatment, payment, operations, research, public health, quality measures, health status evaluation by third parties, or marketing   • Under certain conditions, e.g. when unconscious   • For specified time period, e.g. effective and expiration dates   • In certain context, e.g. in an emergency   A consent directive is an instance of governing jurisdictional and organization privacy policies, which may or may not be backed up by a signed document (paper or electronic). [HITSP TP30].
The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.name: ConsentDirective.identifier
element.definition: Unique identifier for this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.issued
element.short: When this Consent Directive was issued
element.definition: Date and time when this Consent Directive was executed and became effective.

element.name: ConsentDirective.applies
element.definition: Time period during which this Consent Directive is in effect.

element.name: ConsentDirective.subject
element.definition: Patient information and actions taken on that information that are governed by this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.authority
element.short: Authority under which this Consent Directive has standing
element.definition: A formally recognized grouping of people, principals, organizations, or jurisdictions with legal standing to promulgate, administer, and enforce privacy policies and applicable Consent Directives.

element.name: ConsentDirective.domain
element.short: Domain in which this Consent Directive applies
element.definition: Recognized governance framework or system operating with a circumscribed scope in accordance with specified principles, policies, processes or procedures for managing rights, actions, or behaviors of parties or principals relative to privacy protection and control of the collection, access, use and disclosure of resources.

element.name: ConsentDirective.type
element.definition: Specific type of patient privacy Consent Directive reflecting the range of patient discretion over granting of rights to patient information and actions that may be taken on that information; e.g. Opt-in, opt-out, Share All (such as authorization to disclose to payer for payment purposes or benefit eligibility), Share Partial(such as Title 38 Section 7332 and 42 CFR Part 2), Implied Consent, such as a HIPAA Notice of Privacy Practices.

element.name: ConsentDirective.subType
element.definition: A specialized type of an overarching or more general Consent Directive, such as a patient's right to opt-out of a Patient Directory under HIPAA or a multiparty 42 CFR Part 2 consent used in a health information exchange context by a Qualified Service Organization.

element.name: ConsentDirective.action
element.definition: Action stipulated by this Consent Directive.

binding.description: Detailed codes for the contract action.

element.name: ConsentDirective.actionReason
element.definition: Reason for action stipulated by this Consent Directive.

binding.description: Detailed codes for the contract action reason.

element.name: ConsentDirective.actor
element.definition: List of Consent Directive actors.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.definition: Who or what actors are assigned roles in this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.actor.role
element.definition: Role type of actors assigned roles in this Consent Directive.

binding.description: Detailed codes for the contract actor role.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem
element.definition: Contract Valued Item List.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.entity[x]
element.definition: Specific type of Contract Valued Item that may be priced.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.identifier
element.definition: Identifies a Contract Valued Item instance.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.effectiveTime
element.definition: Indicates the time during which this Contract ValuedItem information is effective.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.quantity
element.definition: Specifies the units by which the Contract Valued Item is measured or counted, and quantifies the countable or measurable Contract Valued Item instances.
element.comments: The context of use may frequently define what kind of quantity this is and therefore what kind of units can be used. The context of use may also restrict the values for the comparator.

constraint.human: If a code for the unit is present, the system SHALL also be present
The comparator is not used on a SimpleQuantity

mapping.map: PQ, IVL<PQ>, MO, CO, depending on the values

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.unitprice
element.short: Contract Valued Item fee, charge, or cost.
element.definition: A Contract Valued Item unit valuation measure.
element.comments: The context of use may frequently define what kind of quantity this is and therefore what kind of units can be used. The context of use may also restrict the values for the comparator.

constraint.human: If a code for the unit is present, the system SHALL also be present
There SHALL be a code if there is a value and it SHALL be an expression of currency.  If system is present, it SHALL be ISO 4217 (system = "urn:iso:std:iso:4217" - currency).

mapping.map: PQ, IVL<PQ>, MO, CO, depending on the values

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.factor
element.short: Contract Valued Item Price Scaling Factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of the Contract Valued Item delivered. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.points
element.short: Contract Valued Item Difficulty Scaling Factor
element.definition: An amount that expresses the weighting (based on difficulty, cost and/or resource intensiveness) associated with the Contract Valued Item delivered. The concept of Points allows for assignment of point values for a Contract Valued Item, such that a monetary amount can be assigned to each point.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.net
element.definition: Expresses the product of the Contract Valued Item unitQuantity and the unitPriceAmt. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
element.comments: The context of use may frequently define what kind of quantity this is and therefore what kind of units can be used. The context of use may also restrict the values for the comparator.

constraint.human: If a code for the unit is present, the system SHALL also be present
There SHALL be a code if there is a value and it SHALL be an expression of currency.  If system is present, it SHALL be ISO 4217 (system = "urn:iso:std:iso:4217" - currency).

mapping.map: PQ, IVL<PQ>, MO, CO, depending on the values

element.name: ConsentDirective.signer
element.definition: Party signing this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.signer.type
element.definition: Role of this Consent Directive signer, e.g. patient who is Consent Directive Grantee, the Substitute Decision Maker such as a person with Power of Attorney to whom the patient has granted or delegated rights to execute a Consent Directive on the patient's behalf, a notary public or witness.

binding.description: List of parties who may be signing.

element.name: ConsentDirective.signer.party
element.definition: Party which is a signatory to this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.signer.signature
element.definition: Legally binding Consent Directive DSIG signature contents in Base64.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.identifier
element.definition: Unique identifier for this particular Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.issued
element.short: Consent Directive Term Issue Date Time
element.definition: When this Consent Directive Provision was issued.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.applies
element.definition: Relevant time or time-period when this Consent Directive Provision is applicable.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.type
element.definition: Type of Consent Directive Provision such as specific requirements, purposes for actions, obligations, prohibitions, e.g. life time maximum benefit.

binding.description: Detailed codes for the types of contract provisions.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.subType
element.definition: Subtype of this Consent Directive Provision, e.g. life time maximum payment for a contract term for specific valued item, e.g. disability payment.

binding.description: Detailed codes for the subtypes of contract provisions.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.subject
element.short: Subject  of this Consent Directive Term
element.definition: Who or what this Consent Directive Provision is about.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.action
element.definition: Action stipulated by this Consent Directive Provision.

binding.description: Detailed codes for the contract action.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.actionReason
element.definition: Reason or purpose for the action stipulated by this Consent Directive Provision.

binding.description: Detailed codes for the contract action reason.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.actor
element.definition: List of actors participating in this Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.entity[x]
element.definition: Specific type of Contract Provision Valued Item that may be priced.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.
element.definition: Identifies a Contract Provision Valued Item instance.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.effectiveTime
element.short: Contract Term Valued Item Effective Time
element.definition: Indicates the time during which this Contract Term ValuedItem information is effective.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.quantity
element.definition: Specifies the units by which the Contract Provision Valued Item is measured or counted, and quantifies the countable or measurable Contract Term Valued Item instances.
element.comments: The context of use may frequently define what kind of quantity this is and therefore what kind of units can be used. The context of use may also restrict the values for the comparator.

constraint.human: If a code for the unit is present, the system SHALL also be present
The comparator is not used on a SimpleQuantity

mapping.map: PQ, IVL<PQ>, MO, CO, depending on the values

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.unitPrice
element.short: Contract Term Valued Item fee, charge, or cost.
element.definition: A Contract Provision Valued Item unit valuation measure.
element.comments: The context of use may frequently define what kind of quantity this is and therefore what kind of units can be used. The context of use may also restrict the values for the comparator.

constraint.human: If a code for the unit is present, the system SHALL also be present
There SHALL be a code if there is a value and it SHALL be an expression of currency.  If system is present, it SHALL be ISO 4217 (system = "urn:iso:std:iso:4217" - currency).

mapping.map: PQ, IVL<PQ>, MO, CO, depending on the values

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.factor
element.short: Contract Term Valued Item Price Scaling Factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of the Contract Provision Valued Item delivered. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.points
element.short: Contract Term Valued Item Difficulty Scaling Factor
element.definition: An amount that expresses the weighting (based on difficulty, cost and/or resource intensiveness) associated with the Contract Provision Valued Item delivered. The concept of Points allows for assignment of point values for a Contract Provision Valued Item, such that a monetary amount can be assigned to each point.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.net
element.short: Total Contract Term Valued Item Value
element.definition: Expresses the product of the Contract Provision Valued Item unitQuantity and the unitPriceAmt. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
element.comments: The context of use may frequently define what kind of quantity this is and therefore what kind of units can be used. The context of use may also restrict the values for the comparator.

constraint.human: If a code for the unit is present, the system SHALL also be present
There SHALL be a code if there is a value and it SHALL be an expression of currency.  If system is present, it SHALL be ISO 4217 (system = "urn:iso:std:iso:4217" - currency).

mapping.map: PQ, IVL<PQ>, MO, CO, depending on the values

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.group
element.definition: Nested group of Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.binding[x]
element.definition: Legally binding onsent Directive Provision.  This is the signed and legally recognized representation of the Consent Directive. that is considered the "source of truth", which would be the basis for legal action related to enforcement of the onsent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.friendly
element.definition: The "patient friendly language" versionof the Consent Directive in whole or in parts. "Patient friendly language" means the representation of the  Consent Directive and  Consent Directive Provisions in a manner that is readily accessible and understandable by a layperson in accordance with best practices for communication styles that ensure that those agreeing to or signing the  Consent Directive understand the roles, actions, obligations, responsibilities, and implication of the agreement.

element.definition: Computable Consent Directive conveyed using a policy rule language (e.g. XACML, DKAL, SecPal).

element.name: ConsentDirective
element.definition: A record of a healthcare consumer’s privacy policy, which is in accordance with governing jurisdictional and organization privacy policies that grant or withhold consent:   • To one or more identified entities in a defined role   • To perform one or more operations (e.g. collect, access, use, disclose, amend, or delete)   • On an instance or type of individually identifiable health information [IIHI]  • For a purpose such as treatment, payment, operations, research, public health, quality measures, health status evaluation by third parties, or marketing   • Under certain conditions, e.g. when unconscious   • For specified time period, e.g. effective and expiration dates   • In certain context, e.g. in an emergency   A consent directive is an instance of governing jurisdictional and organization privacy policies, which may or may not be backed up by a signed document (paper or electronic). [HITSP TP30].

element.name: ConsentDirective.identifier
element.definition: Unique identifier for this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.issued
element.short: When this Consent Directive was issued
element.definition: Date and time when this Consent Directive was executed and became effective.

element.name: ConsentDirective.applies
element.definition: Time period during which this Consent Directive is in effect.

element.name: ConsentDirective.subject
element.definition: Patient information and actions taken on that information that are governed by this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.authority
element.short: Authority under which this Consent Directive has standing
element.definition: A formally recognized grouping of people, principals, organizations, or jurisdictions with legal standing to promulgate, administer, and enforce privacy policies and applicable Consent Directives.

element.name: ConsentDirective.domain
element.short: Domain in which this Consent Directive applies
element.definition: Recognized governance framework or system operating with a circumscribed scope in accordance with specified principles, policies, processes or procedures for managing rights, actions, or behaviors of parties or principals relative to privacy protection and control of the collection, access, use and disclosure of resources.

element.name: ConsentDirective.type
element.definition: Specific type of patient privacy Consent Directive reflecting the range of patient discretion over granting of rights to patient information and actions that may be taken on that information; e.g. Opt-in, opt-out, Share All (such as authorization to disclose to payer for payment purposes or benefit eligibility), Share Partial(such as Title 38 Section 7332 and 42 CFR Part 2), Implied Consent, such as a HIPAA Notice of Privacy Practices.

element.name: ConsentDirective.subType
element.definition: A specialized type of an overarching or more general Consent Directive, such as a patient's right to opt-out of a Patient Directory under HIPAA or a multiparty 42 CFR Part 2 consent used in a health information exchange context by a Qualified Service Organization.

element.name: ConsentDirective.action
element.definition: Action stipulated by this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.actionReason
element.definition: Reason for action stipulated by this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.actor
element.definition: List of Consent Directive actors.

element.name: ConsentDirective.actor.entity
element.definition: Who or what actors are assigned roles in this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.actor.role
element.definition: Role type of actors assigned roles in this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem
element.definition: Contract Valued Item List.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.entity[x]
element.definition: Specific type of Contract Valued Item that may be priced.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.identifier
element.definition: Identifies a Contract Valued Item instance.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.effectiveTime
element.definition: Indicates the time during which this Contract ValuedItem information is effective.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.quantity
element.definition: Specifies the units by which the Contract Valued Item is measured or counted, and quantifies the countable or measurable Contract Valued Item instances.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.unitprice
element.short: Contract Valued Item fee, charge, or cost.
element.definition: A Contract Valued Item unit valuation measure.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.factor
element.short: Contract Valued Item Price Scaling Factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of the Contract Valued Item delivered. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.points
element.short: Contract Valued Item Difficulty Scaling Factor
element.definition: An amount that expresses the weighting (based on difficulty, cost and/or resource intensiveness) associated with the Contract Valued Item delivered. The concept of Points allows for assignment of point values for a Contract Valued Item, such that a monetary amount can be assigned to each point.

element.name: ConsentDirective.valuedItem.net
element.definition: Expresses the product of the Contract Valued Item unitQuantity and the unitPriceAmt. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.name: ConsentDirective.signer
element.definition: Party signing this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.signer.type
element.definition: Role of this Consent Directive signer, e.g. patient who is Consent Directive Grantee, the Substitute Decision Maker such as a person with Power of Attorney to whom the patient has granted or delegated rights to execute a Consent Directive on the patient's behalf, a notary public or witness.

element.name: ConsentDirective.signer.party
element.definition: Party which is a signatory to this Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.signer.signature
element.definition: Legally binding Consent Directive DSIG signature contents in Base64.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term
element.definition: One or more Consent DirectiveProvisions, which may be related and conveyed as a group, and may contain nested groups.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.identifier
element.definition: Unique identifier for this particular Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.issued
element.short: Consent Directive Term Issue Date Time
element.definition: When this Consent Directive Provision was issued.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.applies
element.definition: Relevant time or time-period when this Consent Directive Provision is applicable.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.type
element.definition: Type of Consent Directive Provision such as specific requirements, purposes for actions, obligations, prohibitions, e.g. life time maximum benefit.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.subType
element.definition: Subtype of this Consent Directive Provision, e.g. life time maximum payment for a contract term for specific valued item, e.g. disability payment.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.subject
element.short: Subject  of this Consent Directive Term
element.definition: Who or what this Consent Directive Provision is about.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.action
element.definition: Action stipulated by this Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.actionReason
element.definition: Reason or purpose for the action stipulated by this Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.actor
element.definition: List of actors participating in this Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.actor.entity
element.definition: The actor assigned a role in this Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.actor.role
element.definition: Role played by the actor assigned this role in this Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.text
element.short: Human readable Consent Directive term text
element.definition: Human readable form of this Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem
element.definition: Contract Provision Valued Item List.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.entity[x]
element.definition: Specific type of Contract Provision Valued Item that may be priced.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.
element.definition: Identifies a Contract Provision Valued Item instance.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.effectiveTime
element.short: Contract Term Valued Item Effective Time
element.definition: Indicates the time during which this Contract Term ValuedItem information is effective.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.quantity
element.definition: Specifies the units by which the Contract Provision Valued Item is measured or counted, and quantifies the countable or measurable Contract Term Valued Item instances.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.unitPrice
element.short: Contract Term Valued Item fee, charge, or cost.
element.definition: A Contract Provision Valued Item unit valuation measure.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.factor
element.short: Contract Term Valued Item Price Scaling Factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of the Contract Provision Valued Item delivered. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.points
element.short: Contract Term Valued Item Difficulty Scaling Factor
element.definition: An amount that expresses the weighting (based on difficulty, cost and/or resource intensiveness) associated with the Contract Provision Valued Item delivered. The concept of Points allows for assignment of point values for a Contract Provision Valued Item, such that a monetary amount can be assigned to each point.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.valuedItem.net
element.short: Total Contract Term Valued Item Value
element.definition: Expresses the product of the Contract Provision Valued Item unitQuantity and the unitPriceAmt. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.name: ConsentDirective.term.group
element.definition: Nested group of Consent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.binding[x]
element.definition: Legally binding onsent Directive Provision.  This is the signed and legally recognized representation of the Consent Directive. that is considered the "source of truth", which would be the basis for legal action related to enforcement of the onsent Directive Provision.

element.name: ConsentDirective.friendly
element.definition: The "patient friendly language" versionof the Consent Directive in whole or in parts. "Patient friendly language" means the representation of the  Consent Directive and  Consent Directive Provisions in a manner that is readily accessible and understandable by a layperson in accordance with best practices for communication styles that ensure that those agreeing to or signing the  Consent Directive understand the roles, actions, obligations, responsibilities, and implication of the agreement.

element.name: ConsentDirective.friendly.content[x]
element.short: Easily comprehended representation of this Consent Directive
element.definition: Human readable rendering of this  Consent Directive in a format and representation intended to enhance comprehension and ensure understandability.

element.name: ConsentDirective.legal
element.definition: List of Legal expressions or representations of this  Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.legal.content[x]
element.definition: Legal  Consent Directive text in human renderable form.

element.name: ConsentDirective.rule
element.definition: List of Computable Policy Rule Language Representations of this  Consent Directive.

element.name: ConsentDirective.rule.content[x]
element.definition: Computable Consent Directive conveyed using a policy rule language (e.g. XACML, DKAL, SecPal).
